title: Assign season based on month Maps numeric or character month values to seasons (Winter, Spring, Summer, Fall). â€” assign_season
code: assign_season(c("01", "04", "07", "10")) #> Error in case_when(month %in% c("12", "01", "02") ~ "Winter", month %in%     c("03", "04", "05") ~ "Spring", month %in% c("06", "07",     "08") ~ "Summer", month %in% c("09", "10", "11") ~ "Fall",     TRUE ~ "Unknown"): could not find function "case_when" assign_season(c(1, 3, 8)) #> Error in case_when(month %in% c("12", "01", "02") ~ "Winter", month %in%     c("03", "04", "05") ~ "Spring", month %in% c("06", "07",     "08") ~ "Summer", month %in% c("09", "10", "11") ~ "Fall",     TRUE ~ "Unknown"): could not find function "case_when"

what: Calculate animal age in years from date of birth â€” calculate_age_years
title: Calculate animal age in years from date of birth â€” calculate_age_years
text: function converts dates birth ages years, handling single dates vectors dates, proper NA handling.

title: Calculate animal age in years from date of birth â€” calculate_age_years
code: calculate_age_years(dob, reference_date = Sys.Date())

title: Calculate animal age in years from date of birth â€” calculate_age_years
text: dob Date object character vector birth dates "YYYY-MM-DD" format reference_date reference date age calculation, defaults current date

title: Calculate animal age in years from date of birth â€” calculate_age_years
text: integer vector representing ages years

title: Calculate animal age in years from date of birth â€” calculate_age_years
code: # Single date calculate_age_years("2015-01-01") #> [1] 10 # Vector of dates calculate_age_years(c("2010-05-15", "2018-10-20", ...)) #> Error in calculate_age_years(c("2010-05-15", "2018-10-20", ...)): '...' used in an incorrect context # With custom reference date calculate_age_years("2015-01-01", reference_date = "2020-01-01") #> [1] 5

what: Evaluate a classification model â€” evaluate_rf_model

text: function evaluates trained model test data, computing confusion matrix, metrics, summary statistics binary classification.

title: Evaluate a classification model â€” evaluate_rf_model
text: model Trained model object (e.g., randomForest) test_d data frame containing test data target_col name target column. Default: "adopted" positive_level positive class level. Default: "Yes" negative_level negative class level. Default: ""

title: Evaluate a classification model â€” evaluate_rf_model
text: list containing: confusion_matrix (caret confusionMatrix object), metrics (dataframe performance metrics), cm_summary (confusion matrix summary)

title: Evaluate a classification model â€” evaluate_rf_model
code: # Defult usage results <- evaluate_rf_model(rf_model, test_data) #> Error: object 'rf_model' not found # Access components metrics_df <- results$metrics #> Error: object 'results' not found conf_matrix <- results$confusion_matrix #> Error: object 'results' not found

what: Plot confusion matrix as a heatmap Creates a heatmap visualization of a confusion matrix. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_confusion_matrix
title: Plot confusion matrix as a heatmap Creates a heatmap visualization of a confusion matrix. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_confusion_matrix
text: Plot confusion matrix heatmap Creates heatmap visualization confusion matrix. Optionally saves plot file.

title: Plot confusion matrix as a heatmap Creates a heatmap visualization of a confusion matrix. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_confusion_matrix
code: plot_confusion_matrix(   cm,   path_saved = NULL,   color_low = "#f1f1f1",   color_high = "#1f77b4",   text_color = "white",   text_size = 8,   title = "Confusion Matrix Heatmap",   width = NULL,   height = NULL )

title: Plot confusion matrix as a heatmap Creates a heatmap visualization of a confusion matrix. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_confusion_matrix
text: cm caret confusionMatrix object path_saved File path save plot. NULL, plot returned saved. color_low Color low values gradient. Default: "#f1f1f1" (light gray) color_high Color high values gradient. Default: "#1f77b4" (blue) text_color Color text labels. Default: "white" text_size Size text labels. Default: 8 title Plot title. Default: "Confusion Matrix Heatmap" width Plot width inches saving. Default: 8 height Plot height inches saving. Default: 7

title: Plot confusion matrix as a heatmap Creates a heatmap visualization of a confusion matrix. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_confusion_matrix
text: Invisibly returns ggplot object.

title: Plot confusion matrix as a heatmap Creates a heatmap visualization of a confusion matrix. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_confusion_matrix
code: plot_confusion_matrix(cm) #> Error in plot_confusion_matrix(cm): The 'cm' parameter must be a confusionMatrix object from the caret package plot_confusion_matrix(cm, path_saved = "cm_plot.png") #> Error in plot_confusion_matrix(cm, path_saved = "cm_plot.png"): The 'cm' parameter must be a confusionMatrix object from the caret package

what: Plot feature importance from a random forest model Plots variable importance scores from a trained Random Forest model. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_feature_importance
title: Plot feature importance from a random forest model Plots variable importance scores from a trained Random Forest model. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_feature_importance
text: Plot feature importance random forest model Plots variable importance scores trained Random Forest model. Optionally saves plot file.

title: Plot feature importance from a random forest model Plots variable importance scores from a trained Random Forest model. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_feature_importance
code: plot_feature_importance(   model,   path_saved = NULL,   fill_color = "steelblue",   importance_type = 1,   title = "Feature Importance",   width = NULL,   height = NULL )

title: Plot feature importance from a random forest model Plots variable importance scores from a trained Random Forest model. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_feature_importance
text: model Trained random forest model path_saved File path save plot. NULL, plot returned saved. fill_color Color bars. Default: "steelblue" importance_type Type importance plot. Either "MeanDecreaseAccuracy" (1) "MeanDecreaseGini" (2). Default: 1 title Plot title. Default: "Feature Importance" width Plot width inches saving. Default: 10 height Plot height inches saving. Default: 8

title: Plot feature importance from a random forest model Plots variable importance scores from a trained Random Forest model. Optionally saves the plot to a file. â€” plot_feature_importance
text: Invisibly returns ggplot object.

what: Train a Random Forest model â€” train_rf_model
title: Train a Random Forest model â€” train_rf_model
text: Trains Random Forest model using provided formula data. Handles standard dot notation formula. Checks missing variables ensures reproducibility via seed.

title: Train a Random Forest model â€” train_rf_model
code: train_rf_model(d, formula, ntree = 100, mtry = 2, seed = 123)

title: Train a Random Forest model â€” train_rf_model
text: d data frame containing training data formula Model formula use training (required) ntree Number trees grow. Default: 100 mtry Number variables randomly sampled split. Default: 2 seed Random seed reproducibility. Default: 123

title: Train a Random Forest model â€” train_rf_model
text: trained randomForest model object

title: Train a Random Forest model â€” train_rf_model
code: model <- train_rf_model(df, adopted ~ age + sex) #> Error in train_rf_model(df, adopted ~ age + sex): `d` must be a data frame.
